sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The arctand function is used to find the arc tangent of an angle given in degrees. For example, arctand (0) is 0.
sections.text_content: The arctand function is used to find the arc tangent of an angle given in degrees. For example, arctand (0) is 0.
sections.mdown_content: The **arctand** function is used to find the arc tangent of an angle given in degrees. For example, **arctand** (0) is 0.

sections.title: Example
code:
for i : 0 .. 12
            const arg := i / 4
            put "Arc tangent of ", arg, " is ",
                arctand (arg), " degrees"
        end for
sections.raw_content: This program prints out the arctangent of values from 0 to 3 in degrees.
sections.text_content: This program prints out the arctangent of values from 0 to 3 in degrees.
sections.mdown_content: This program prints out the arctangent of values from 0 to 3 in degrees.

sections.title: See also
sections.raw_content:
the arcsind and arccosd functions for calculating arcsine and arccosine

the arctan function which finds the arc tangent of a value with the result given in radians. (2p radians are the same as 360 degrees.)

See also predefined unit Math.
sections.text_content:
the arcsind and arccosd functions for calculating arcsine and arccosine
the arctan function which finds the arc tangent of a value with the result given in radians. (2p radians are the same as 360 degrees.)
See also predefined unit Math.
sections.mdown_content:
the **[arcsind.html](arcsind)** and **[arccosd.html](arccosd)** functions for calculating arcsine and arccosine
the **[arctan.html](arctan)** function which finds the arc tangent of a value with the result given in radians. (2p radians are the same as 360 degrees.)
See also predefined unit **[mathmodule.html](Math)**.
